list-item.p: Coxiella burnetii the agent of Q fever, which resulted in a massive outbreak in the Netherlands from 2007 to 2010 precipitated by high-intensity goat farming,
HEV due to increasing reports of RNA-positive blood donors in Japan and Europe; of note, in the Netherlands, increasing numbers precipitated by high-intensity pig farming,
dengue viruses with three transfusion-transmission clusters, one each reported in Hong Kong, Singapore and Puerto Rico,
hepatitis A virus (HAV) due to a large multi-state outbreak in the US,
Anaplasma phagocytophilum with eight transfusion transmissions reported in the US,
Erhlichia including the first report of transfusion transmission in the US,
B. microti with data reported for research testing interventions in the US.
